intro: Cologania tenuis, commonly known as the slender cologania, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Cologania tenuis is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
